comment: This class is so easy and not bad at all. Most of the time, I get an A for quizzes and discussion posts. All you have to do is take a quiz, create questions for a discussion post, and then answer two peers with 250 words. The work can easily be done in 45 minutes in one day take her its not that bad
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Easy class, professor is rather unhelpful though. Does not regard for family emergencies outside of class and won't move deadlines for funerals or similar events. Take class for credit if needed, but make sure not to have any emergencies that require limited internet access or going out of state.
rating_tags: Participation matters--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Her class is quite simple and hard to fail. She gives simple and consistent assignments 3 question discussion post, and you respond to 2 questions, 1quiz a week and enjoyable extra credit opportunities. I love this class,reading isn't insufferable and doesn't take up to much time. As long as you take notes and do the assignments your bound to pass.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria

comment: Very difficult to understand tasks; not clear instructions ; more complicated than needs to be.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. Putala was a great professor, very caring and generous if you contact her with an issue. She gives weekly discussions that take time so do not procrastinate. offers extra credit and a couple of quizzes throughout the semester. Great class, loved it!
rating_tags: Participation matters--EXTRA CREDIT--Gives good feedback

comment: Overall Andrea was an attentive and caring professor. There is a lot of reading and writing in this course so if those aren't your strong suits you might not do well. She responds to emails in a timely manner and is very easy to talk to. The final is a paper on one of four movie choices she provides. As long as you put the effort in you'll do great
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Gives good feedback

comment:
Her final exam requirements are a bit much!! 

She is condescending. It's almost like she doesn't like to be questioned. Or feels as if she's being challenged if it's a question she doesn't like. Along with everything else expressed in the other reviews, you'll have to watch some movies that she requires and answer questions from the movies.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Her class consists of a weekly discussion post that involves you creating 3 questions based on reading and 2 responses that must be 250 words long. She not really clear how long the questions have to be. There's also weekly quizzes that aren't really long around 20-30 questions(no lockdown).Must turn in discussions on Thru. 5pm and Reply Fri 7pm.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Lots of homework

comment: There are discussions every week where you create 3 original questions from the readings and respond to 2 people (250 words for each response). TIP: When completing the discussions DON'T come across as offensive, she will deduct points. 7 Quizzes (open note). Drops lowest quiz and discussion grade. Midterm (open note). Offers Extra Credit!
rating_tags: Participation matters--EXTRA CREDIT--Accessible outside class

comment: If you're interested in Gender Studies, this is a great class w/ a great professor. Lots of reading, but her lectures help you understand it all. Lots of 250 word discussion posts, but the class as a whole isn't demanding, and Professor Putala frequently checks up on the class and welcomes feedback. I think it's cute how she called us starshines.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Online version is easy and interesting, but includes a lot of reading from multiple textbooks and tons of weekly discussion posts. Wouldn't recommend if you're not super interested in gender and sex studies.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: There are two textbooks and the chapters can be long. There are discussions each week where you write three questions about the content and reply to two classmates questions in 250 words. Midterm and Finals are essays. Open note quizzes each week. It is hard to fail if you just do the work. She responds quickly and is nice, its just a lot of work.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Was waitlist for this class because of the reviews and I was fooled. I don't understand how she grades/no clear grading criteria. 250 word 2 replies for each discussion post (sometimes 2/week). Quizzes were simply (no lockdown). Books can be found online for free. But be prepared her tough grading and the final essay which I still don't understand
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: This class is one of the easiest classes you can take. I barely read the textbook and got 100s on everything. Just answer the prompt and you'll get an A. Dr. Putala is very condescending and tells her students not to "freak out" when they ask questions. She is not the best, but it's worth taking her because of how easy it is.
rating_tags: Participation matters--So many papers

comment: took online but very easy. discussion posts each week with 2 responses 250 words each from articles and reading posted. Discussions are easy 100s if you do them on time. She isnt a harsh grader I got a 100 on every discussion that I actually put effort in. The topics are interesting too so its not like boring writing. The quizzes were also easy.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: She was an amazing professor. Very easy to reach out to and responded pretty quick! Highly recommend taking her class!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: I held an A in this class until the final paper. She is unclear about grading criteria, takes forever to get back to emails (if she gets back to you at all), gives SO much busy work and will not hesitate to fail you on any given assignment The course entailed LONG discussion posts every week, quizzes, and a paper for the midterm and the final.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--Tough grader

comment: Professor Putala doesn't give clear grading standards. If you message her or have a question, she gets an attitude with you 10/10 times. It's ironic how rude she can be considering she teaches women and gender studies. Clearly the students and their comprehending of the material isn't what is actually important to her. would not recommend.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--Tough grader

comment: Andrea is a very good professor. You do discussion posts each week but they are really easy and based off of completion. The projects are somewhat complex but as long as you speak to her I believe she takes that into consideration when grading. So make sure you ask questions!
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Tough grader--Get ready to read

comment: She was a very nice professor and I enjoyed her class. Discussions are every week but they are not very hard. The material was interesting and fun to learn. She wants her students to understand the material gives many opportunities to get easy A's. It would be difficult to fail this class. Loved her a lot and I highly recommend her!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Caring
